snippet: The New York Gilbert & Sillivan Players presented “The Sorcerer,” with some sly new touches, at the Lynch Theater.
abstract: Steve Smith reviews New York Gilbert & Sullivan Players production of Gilbert and Sullivan operetta The Sorcerer, directed and conducted by Albert Bergeret and starring Stephen O'Brien at Gerald W Lynch Theater of John Jay College.
lead_paragraph: The New York Gilbert & Sillivan Players presented “The Sorcerer,” with some sly new touches, at the Lynch Theater.

headline.seo: ‘The Sorcerer’ From New York Gilbert & Sullivan Players
headline.main: Gilbert and Sullivan Made Jokes About Costco and Smartphones? Who Knew?
headline.print_headline: Gilbert and Sullivan Made Jokes About Costco and Smartphones? Who Knew?
